newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Naphtha/Mogas-Indonesia mogas buying quietens.
newsitem.headline: Asia Naphtha/Mogas-Indonesia mogas buying quietens.

text.p: Singapore naphtha prices edged up slightly on Tuesday with crude while gasoline held steady as Indonesian buying quietened down, traders said.
"It is not picking up," said one trader on Indonesian demand.
The market has been pinning their hopes on refinery shutdowns in July and August to prompt some regional demand in an otherwise lacklustre market.
Traders said two 120,000-barrel cargoes lifting in July have been sold to Indonesia at a slight premium over Singapore quotes on a fob basis.
But they still assessed the market to be more in a discount of at least as low as 50 cents per barrel amid poor demand.
Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) will issue its regular reformate buy tender on Wednesday, a company official said.
The tender which seeks 250,000 barrels of 95-octane unleaded reformate delivered to Keelung, Kaohsiung, Shalung or Taichung, August 16-31, closes July 9 and is valid for two days.
In the Singapore fob market, traders said a Japanese trader was both offering and bidding for July lifting 92-octane unleaded gasoline at $21.50/$22.50 per barrel.
The August gasoline swap was bid at $23.05 but faced no offers.
Naphtha swaps firmed by 10 cens per barrel, but bids and offers were far apart at $20.45/$20.65 per barrel, trades said.
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
